p: Thyme essential oil at doses 400 and 800 mg/kg used as a DIS was found to reduce oxidative stress of gibel carp ( Carassius auratus gibelio; average weight of 8.73 Â± 2.1 g), and exposure to a sub-acute toxicity level of AgNPs for a period of 96 h after six weeks of a feeding trial confirmed the resistance of the carp to non-fatal effects of AgNPs [ 256]. A fish diet containing 1% Aloe vera NPs improved the growth factors (weight gain, initial body weight, condition factor, feed conversion ratio, specific growth rate) of Siberian sturgeon [ 257]. CS NPs showing spherical shape, particle size 185 nm, and positive zeta potential used to carry vitamin C through the GI tract of rainbow trout ( Oncorhynchus mykiss) exhibited in vivo controlled release until 48 h and increased lysozyme and complement contents in the fish serum [ 258].
